questions.question: What a Stakeholder in the Motivation layer represents?
questions.answer: The role of an individual, team or organization that represents their interests in the effects of the architecture

questions.question: What relations are possible between Motivation elements?
questions.answer: Influence, each motivation element can influence other motivation elements

questions.question: What relations are possible between Driver and Assessment?
questions.answer: Association, a Driver may be associated with an Assessment and an Assessment may be associated with a Driver

questions.question: What relations are possible between Outcome and Goal?
questions.answer: Outcome realizes Goal

questions.question: What elements may be associated with a Driver?
questions.answer: Driver may be associated with Assessment and Goal

questions.question: What elements are part of the Strategy layer?
questions.answer: 1. Course of action; 2. Resource; 3. Capability; 4. Value Stream

questions.question: What are the structure elements of the Strategy layer?
questions.answer: 1. Resource

questions.question: What are the behavior elements of the Strategy layer?
questions.answer: 1. Course of action; 2. Value Stream; 3. Capability

questions.question: What are the strategy behavior elements of the Strategy layer?
questions.answer: 1. Value Stream; 2. Capability

questions.question: What is a Resource in the Strategy layer?
questions.answer: An asset owned or controlled by an individual or an organization

questions.question: What is the categories of a Resource in the Strategy layer?
questions.answer: 1. Tangible assets; 2. Intangible assets; 3. Human assets

questions.question: What are some examples of tangible asset category for a Resource in the Strategy layer?
questions.answer: Financial assets (money); Physical assets (Plant, equipment)

questions.question: What are some examples of intangible asset category for a Resource in the Strategy layer?
questions.answer: Technology assets (patents, copyrights); Reputation assets (brand, relationships); Culture assets

questions.question: What is the preferred way to name a Resource in the Strategy layer?
questions.answer: Noun

questions.question: What a Capability in the Strategy layer represents?
questions.answer: Represents an ability that an active structure element, such as an organization, person, or system, possesses

questions.question: What is a Capability in the Strategy layer?
questions.answer: what the enterprise can (is able to) do (now or in the future)

questions.question: How is realized a Capability in the Strategy layer?
questions.answer: Through a combination of organization, people, processes, information, and technology

questions.question: What is the preferred way to name a Capability in the Strategy layer?
questions.answer: it should be expressed as a compound noun or gerund (-ing form of verb); e.g., “Risk Management”, “Market Development”

questions.question: What a Value Stream in the Strategy layer represents?
questions.answer: Represents a sequence of activities that creates an overall result for a customer, stakeholder or end user

questions.question: How should be defined a Value Stream in the Strategy layer?
questions.answer: Always from the perspective of the stakeholder (customer, end user or recipient of the product/service)

questions.question: What a Value Stream in the Strategy layer is composed of?
questions.answer: Value-adding activities known as value (stream) stages

questions.question: How are Value Streams in the Strategy layer realized?
questions.answer: Realized by business processes

questions.question: What is the preferred way to name a Value Stream in the Strategy layer?
questions.answer: using a verb-noun construct in the active tense; e.g., “Acquire Insurance Product”.

questions.question: What a Course of Action in the Strategy layer represents?
questions.answer: Represents an approach or plan for configuring some capabilities and resources of the enterprise, undertaken to achieve some goal

questions.question: What are the categories of Course of Action in the Strategy layer?
questions.answer: 1. Strategies; 2. Tatics

questions.question: What are the differences between the categories of Course of Action in the Strategy layer?
questions.answer: Strategies tend to be long-term and fairly broad in scope while tatics tend to be shorter-term and narrower in scope

questions.question: What are the possible relations between a Resource and a Strategy Behavior Element?
questions.answer: A Resource is assigned to a Strategy Behavior Element. If un resource is assigned to the capability, it means that the resource is required for tha capability to work and exist

questions.question: What are the possible relations between a Strategy Behavior Element and a Course of Action?
questions.answer: A Strategy Behavior Element can either serve or realize a Course of Action

questions.question: What are the possible relations between a Course of Action and a Course of Action?
questions.answer: triggers/flows to/serve

questions.question: What are the possible relations between a Strategy Behavior Element and a Strategy Behavior Element?
questions.answer: triggers/flows to/serve

questions.question: What elements are part of the Business Layer Internal Active Structure?
questions.answer: 1. Business Role; 2. Business Actor; 3. Business Collaboration

questions.question: What is a Business Actor?
questions.answer: Represents a business entity capable of performing behavior

questions.question: What are some examples of a Business Actor?
questions.answer: Person, Business Unit, Organizations

questions.question: What is the preferred way to name a Business Actor?
questions.answer: Noun

questions.question: What a Business Role represents?
questions.answer: Represents the responsibility for performing specific behavior, to which an actor can be assigned, or the part an actor plays in particular action or event

questions.question: What happens when a Business Actor is assigned to a Business Role?
questions.answer: The Business Actor becomes responsible for performing the behavior, either by doing it himself or delegating it to somebody else

questions.question: What is the relation between Business Role and Business Processes or Business Functions?
questions.answer: A Business Role may be assigned to one or more Business Processes or Business Functions

questions.question: What is the relation between Business Role and Business Actor?
questions.answer: A Business Actor may be assigned to one or more Business Roles

questions.question: What a Business Collaboration represents?
questions.answer: Represents an aggregated of two or more business internal active structure elements that work together to perform collective behavior

questions.question: What is a Business Collaboration?
questions.answer: A Business Collaboration is a (possibly temporary) collection of business roles, actors, or other collaborations within an organization which perform collaborative behavior (interactions)

questions.question: What is the preferred way to name a Business Collaboration?
questions.answer: Noun but it can be unname also

questions.question: What a Business Interface represents?
questions.answer: Represents a point of access where business service are made available to the environment

questions.question: What a Business Interface does?
questions.answer: It exposes the functionality of a Business Service to other Business Roles or Business Actors

questions.question: What is the relation between Business Interface and Business Service?
questions.answer: A Business Interface may be assigned to one or more Business Services

questions.question: What are some examples of Business Interface?
questions.answer: Telephone, Internet, Local office

questions.question: What is the preferred way to name a Business Interface?
questions.answer: Noun

questions.question: What are the Business Internal Behavior Elements?
questions.answer: 1. Business Process; 2. Business Function; 3. Business Interaction

questions.question: What a Business Process represents?
questions.answer: Represents a sequence of business behaviors that achieves a specific result such as a defined set of products or business services

questions.question: What a Business Process describes?
questions.answer: Describes the internal behavior performed by a business role that is required to produce a set of products and services

questions.question: What is the difference between Business Process and Business Function?
questions.answer: Business Process describes some kind of 'flow' of activities, whereas Business Function group activities according to required skills, knowledge, resources, etc.

questions.question: How do we know the Business Process is being performed manually or automatically?
questions.answer: If a Business Role is assigned to the Business Process it is being done automatically; if it is realized by an Application Process is automatically

questions.question: What is the preferred way to name a Business Process?
questions.answer: Noun or verb-noun combination and may include the word 'process'

questions.question: What a Business Function represents?
questions.answer: Represents a collection of business behavior based on a chosen set of criteria such as required business resources and/or competencies, and is managed or performed as a whole

questions.question: What is the relationship between a Business Function and a Capability?
questions.answer: Business Function can realize capabilities

questions.question: What is the relationship between a Business Function and other Business Behavior elements?
questions.answer: Business Function can trigger o be triggered by a Business Behavior element

questions.question: What is the relationship between a Business Function and a Business Service?
questions.answer: Business Function may realize one or more Business Services

questions.question: What elements may serve a Business Function?
questions.answer: Business Function may be served by Business, Application, or Technology services

questions.question: What elements may be assigned to Business Function?
questions.answer: A Business Role may be assigned to a Business Function

questions.question: What is the recommendation about Business Function name?
questions.answer: It should clearly define what it does, well-defined behavior

questions.question: What a Business Interaction represents?
questions.answer: Represents a unir of collective business behavior performed by (a collaboration of) two or more business actors, business roles, or business collaborations

questions.question: What is the relationship between a Business Interaction and other Business Behavior elements?
questions.answer: Business Interaction can trigger o be triggered by a Business Behavior element

questions.question: What is the relationship between a Business Interaction and a Business Service?
questions.answer: A Business interaction may realize one or more business services

questions.question: What is the recommendation about Business Interaction name?
questions.answer: A verb in the simple past tense

questions.question: What a Business Event represents?
questions.answer: Represents a business-related state change

questions.question: What is the preferred way to name a Business Event?
questions.answer: Verb in the perfect tense

questions.question: What a Business Event triggers/flows or is triggered by?
questions.answer: Business Service, Business Internal Behavior Element, and other Business Events

questions.question: What a Business Service represents?
questions.answer: Represents explicitly defined behavior that a Business Role, Business Actor, or Business Collaboration exposes to its environment

questions.question: How can a Business Service be accessed?
questions.answer: Business Services are accessed through Business Interface

questions.question: What may be the relation between a Business Service and a Business Interface?
questions.answer: Business Interface is assigned to a Business Service

questions.question: What a Business Object represents?
questions.answer: A concept used within a particular business domain

questions.question: What a Business Object usually models?
questions.answer: It models an object type of which multiple instances may exist in operations

questions.question: What Business Elements may access Business Objects?
questions.answer: 1. Business Process; 2. Business Function; 3. Business Interaction; 4. Business Event; 5. Business Service

questions.question: What a Contrat represents?
questions.answer: Formal or informal specification of an agreement between a provider and a consumer that specifies the rights and obligations associated with a product and establishes functional and non-functional parameters for interaction

questions.question: What relationship does has a Contrat with a Business Object?
questions.answer: A Contrat is an specialization of a Business Object

questions.question: What relationship does has a Contrat with a Business Object?
questions.answer: A Contrat is an specialization of a Business Object

questions.question: What relationship may has a Contrat with a Business Product?
questions.answer: A Contrat may have an aggregation relationship with a Product

questions.question: What relationship may has a Contrat with a Business Product?
questions.answer: A Contrat may have an aggregation relationship with a Product

questions.question: What is the preferred way to name a Contrat?
questions.answer: Noun

questions.question: What a Representations represents?
questions.answer: A perceptible form of the information carried by a Business Object

questions.question: What are the composite elements of Business Layer?
questions.answer: 1. Product

questions.question: What a Business Product represents?
questions.answer: Coherent collection of services and/or passive structure elements, accompanied by a contract, which is offered as a whole to (internal or external) customers

questions.question: What does the Implementation and Strategy layer?
questions.answer: It expresses the required changes in enterprise

questions.question: What are the elements of the Implementation and Strategy layer?
questions.answer: 1. Plateau; 2. Gap; 3. Deliverable; 4. Work package; 5. Implementation event

questions.question: What are the composite elements of the Implementation and Strategy layer?
questions.answer: 1. Plateau

questions.question: What are the Passive structure elements of the Implementation and Strategy layer?
questions.answer: 1. Gap; 2. Deliverable

questions.question: What are the Internal Behavior elements of the Implementation and Strategy layer?
questions.answer: 1. Work Package

questions.question: What are the Event of the Implementation and Strategy layer?
questions.answer: 1. Implementatio Event

questions.question: What is a Work package of the Implementation and Strategy layer?
questions.answer: Is a unique one-off process that produces defined results

questions.question: What does a Work package represents in the Implementation and Strategy layer?
questions.answer: A series of actions identified and designed to achieve specific results within specified time and resource constraints

questions.question: What are the characteristics of Work package in the Implementation and Strategy layer?
questions.answer: 1. Has a start and end date; 2. Produces defined results (Goals, Outcomes, Deliverables)

questions.question: What is Work package in the Implementation and Strategy layer used for?
questions.answer: Work or task performed within projects. programs, project portfolio and agile

questions.question: What is Implement Event in the Implementation and Strategy layer?
questions.answer: Changes an implementation-related state

questions.question: What does a Implement Event represents in the Implementation and Strategy layer?
questions.answer: Instantaneous state change related to implementation or migration

questions.question: What a Implement Event represents in the Implementation and Strategy layer may access to?
questions.answer: Deliverables

questions.question: What a Implement Event represents in the Implementation and Strategy layer may trigger or be triggered by?
questions.answer: 1. Work Packages; 2. Plateaus

questions.question: What a Implement Event represents in the Implementation and Strategy layer may be associated with?
questions.answer: Any core element

questions.question: What is the recommendation regards the name of Implement Event in the Implementation and Strategy layer?
questions.answer: Should be formulated as a verb in perfect tense

questions.question: What is a Deliverable in the Implementation and Strategy layer?
questions.answer: Is a result produced by a Work Package

questions.question: What does a Deliverable in the Implementation and Strategy layer represents?
questions.answer: A precisely defined result of a Work Package

questions.question: What is a characteristic of Deliverable in the Implementation and Strategy layer?
questions.answer: Often contractually specified and in turn formally reviewed, agreed and signed off by the stakeholder

questions.question: What a Deliverable in the Implementation and Strategy layer may be?
questions.answer: May be a tangible document, an intagible organizational change or a implementation of an Enterprise Architecture

questions.question: What a Gap in the Implementation and Strategy layer defines?
questions.answer: Defines the differences between two Plateaus

questions.question: What does Gap in the Implementation and Strategy layer represents?
questions.answer: A statement of difference between two Plateaus as well as between the Baseline and Target architecture

questions.question: What elements are associated with Gaps of Implementation and Strategy layer?
questions.answer: two Plateaus, two consecutive transitions

questions.question: What is a Plateau in Implementation and Strategy layer?
questions.answer: Transition periods between baseline and target architecture

questions.question: What does a Plateau in Implementation and Strategy layer represents?
questions.answer: It represents a relatively stable state of the Enterprise Architecture that exists during a limited period of time

questions.question: What does a Plateau in Implementation and Strategy layer allows?
questions.answer: Group Work Packagess and projects into a Transition Architecture of managed portfolios and programs
